fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary 

Smart links when added to comment are shown twice in slack
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Integrate Slack with Jira
 # Add a smart link in the comment section
 # Check slack update that has been triggered

h3. Expected Results

Only the link should be added
h3. Actual Results

[[https://dexter1234.atlassian.net/browse/ABC-10009%7Chttps://dexter1234.atlassian.net/browse/ABC-10009%7Csmart-link]]
fields.summary: Slack shows smart link url twice

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update - April 22, 2021}Hello everyone! We realized that this request was a duplicate of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63388 and we have decided to merge them to keep the feedback in a single place, and also ensure we are tracking the number of teams affected by this more accurately. We have already considered all the cases reported here at JRACLOUD-63388. Please feel free to watch that issue instead of this one.{panel}

h3. Issue Summary
When exporting issues that contain inward issue link, there is no column for Inward issue link in the export .csv file.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create issue A and B
# Link issue A to B (e.g _relates to_ link)
# Search for issue A and B in issue navigator
# Export these issues by using _Export Excel CSV_ via the export feature

h3. Expected Results
The CSV file should have both _Inward issue link_ and Outward issue link_

h3. Actual Results
The CSV file contains only _Outward issue link_



h3. Workaround
Alternatively, you can use [Jira Cloud for Sheets|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220382/jira-cloud-for-google-sheets-official?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] as it exports the "Linked Issues" field the way it appears on the JQL Filter.
fields.summary: Export Excel CSV does not export the Inward issue link

fields.description:
Currently, we cannot customize the left-hand panel. Currently, we have everything under Projects given the lack of subfolder structure in Jira, it makes it less scalable if we wanted to organise projects in subfolders. e.g. please have a look Wrike - those guys have nailed this particular requirement where you can organise projects in subfolders just like one would intuitively do on your file system (of any operating system). This also enable the user to replicate structures which they might have on their storage systems and version control systems, keeping Jira consistent across multiple platforms.

So in essence, we dont necessarily need a another folder like Projects in the left panel but some form of folder and sub-folder structure like one have on any operating system.
fields.summary: Customisable tree like structure in left hand panel

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

"Assigned to me" filter in Business boards is not working
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Business Project;
 # Create an issue and assign it to you;
 # Select the "Assigned to me" filter;
 # [Video|https://share.getcloudapp.com/4gumo4jP]

h3. Expected Results

The tickets assigned to me appear on the board.

h3. Actual Results

The unassigned tickets appear on the board.
Refresh the page does not fix the problem.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Assigned to me" filter in Business boards is not working

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
There are some specific situation where the workflow configuration of a Business project will prevent its board from working. The limitations are described on this KB:

* [Work with boards in business projects|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-core-cloud/docs/work-with-boards-in-business-projects/]

However, when admins make changes on the workflows and they fall under those situations, Jira won't warn the admins that the board won't load.

We have similar requests about this subject:

* [JRACLOUD-69467 - Remove "Board" menu from business projects with multiple workflows|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-69467]
* [JRACLOUD-73892 - User should be able to associate multiples workflows in the business projects|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-73892]

h3. Suggested Solution
Jira should warn admins that the Business board won't be available if the workflow modifications meet the specific situations for the board not to work.

h3. Why this is important
This should avoid misleading situations within teams.

h3. Workaround 
If the instance has Jira Software, a Software board can be created for the Business Project.
fields.summary: Business projects should warn admins if the criteria for a board not work is meet

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
All image attachments are missing in the document:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/recent-pages-724765428.html
fields.summary: Missing Attachments in Documentation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Admin Helper tool has been resized to a fixed 360px width for the "Where is my field?" dialogue causing it to be squished in the center of the screen and difficult read the details and difficult to use, as well as having a overall poor look and feel in the application

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to an classic issue
# Select Admin dropdown
# Select "Where is my field?"

h3. Expected Results
Width of the dialogue pop up allows users to see majority of content

h3. Actual Results
The Dialogue box is set to a width of 360px and looks squished in the center of the screen, cutting of a majority of the desired content requiring scrolling to see the results
!Screen Shot 2020-04-03 at 8.10.20 AM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
You can intercept and inject a CSS element to adjust the width on the page from your browser using browser extension tools like "Custom Style scripts" or "Tamper Monkey", look for and modify the style section for "width: 360px" in the following DIV to the desired size, I found 660px is similar in size to the previous size of the dialogue box:
{code}
<div id="whereismycf-dialog" class="jira-dialog box-shadow jira-dialog-open popup-width-small jira-dialog-content-ready" style="width: 360px; margin-left: -180px; margin-top: -291.5px;">
{code}
fields.summary: Admin Helper width resize causes difficulty using "Where is my field?"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description 
While transitioning a ticket and adding a comment in order to see how the comment will be rendered we need to click on "preview" and this is not consistent with the behavior on the comments section.

h3. Suggestion
It would be nice to see the formatting in real-time such as on the new issue view.
fields.summary: Add support to render fields in real-time(WYSIWYG) for transition screens

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, the Jira mobile app is more focused on the collaboration side. 

The only administrative settings towards projects is the ability to change its name, or delete it. While on the user/group administration side, the only option is to invite users.

Jira administrators may need to perform administrative functions on the go, when away from their computers.

h3. Suggestion

Add further administrative options to the Jira mobile app:
* Project settings administration: such as add users to a project;
* User management, and group management: enable admins to control group membership on the mobile app.
fields.summary: Provide further administration features in the Jira mobile app

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When changing the language from account preference, there is a translation delay when navigating through project settings. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change your language from https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences
# Open your Jira and navigate *Project* >*Project Settings*
# Project menu shows English before translating to the correct language. (Delay around 1-2 second)

h3. Expected Results
Improvement from the language translation from account preference. 
h3. Actual Results
Delay for the language translation from Jira's menu

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Delay in language translation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to search text if the string pattern is like "Test_1234_Test - Time" in Global Issue Navigator using text search

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create issue with summary "Test_1234_Test - Time"
 # Search via JQL in Global issue Navigator:

{noformat}
text ~ "Test_1234_Test - Time"
{noformat}

 !image-2020-04-03-15-43-55-287.png|thumbnail! 

No results found

h3. Expected Results
It should return the issue key with details

h3. Actual Results
No issues were found to match your search


If we search from the left had panel search option, it does return the results as it is searchstring.

 !image-2020-04-03-15-44-45-036.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Search the text from left-hand panel search, or surround the phrase with quotation marks (e.g. {code}text ~ "\"Test_1234_Test - Time\""{code}), or cite the minus character with double slashes (e.g. {code}text ~ "Test_1234_Test \\- Time"{code}).
fields.summary: Unable to search text if the string pattern is like "Test_1234_Test - Time" in Global Issue Navigator using text search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While creating an issue, and you mention a user in the issue's *description*, a notification for the mention is not sent out. The notification will only be sent out *if you mention the user after the issue is created*, but not during issue creation.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue in a JIRA instance that has outgoing mail configured.
 # In the description field while creating the issue, mention a user using the "@mention" function.
 # Create the issue.

h3. Expected Results

JIRA would send out a notification for issue creation as well as one to the user mentioned in the description.
h3. Actual Results

JIRA sends out only a notification to confirm issue creation.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Mentioning users in the issue description on issue creation does not send out notifications

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

'Assigned to me' filter in the JIRA core boards isn't working for all users. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a business project
2. Create a new task in the business project and assign it to yourself
3. Create a new task in the business project and let it unassigned
4. Click on 'Assigned to me' filter
h3. Expected Results

User should be able to see all the tasks assigned to him/her in the board.
h3. Actual Results

User is not be able to see the new task assigned to him/her. It shows the unassigned issues.

h3. Workaround
Search your name in the filter box or refresh the page as the issue state is (incorrectly) held in the frontend until reload.
fields.summary: 'Assigned to me' filter in the JIRA coreboards isn't working
Users who don't have the global permission Share dashboards and filters are not displayed with a message when changing an existing filter sharing setting

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there are no options to track issue that was already flagged using "WAS" and "WAS NOT" operator. For example:

{code:sql}project = xxx AND flagged WAS NOT EMPTY {code}


h3. Suggested Solution
Provide "WAS" JQL operator for "Flagged" field.
fields.summary: Ability to use "WAS" JQL operation for "Flagged" field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The favicon for plugin missing in Jira when users using Safari browser. On the left bar the favicon icons, are not visible when navigating through backlogs and sprint. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Safari browser;
# Open Jira and navigate to backlogs, Sprint, and the plugin link.
# Notice that the icons on the left bar are missing.

h3. Expected Results
The favicon should be displayed correctly from the left bar

h3. Actual Results
The favicon on the left bar are not on the page.

h3. *Notes*
Issue was reported to be reproducible only using Safari.

h3. Workaround

Inspecting the plugin link from the left bar and remove fecolormatrix . Otherwise, click on one of the link from the left bar *Components* and the image reappear.
fields.summary: Favicon missing in Jira when using Safari

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the new issue view, when the field is set on "View issue" screen and not "Edit issue" screen the field disappears after loading the page. This only happen when the field is *empty*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Set up the screen with a different field in the "View issue" and "Edit issue" operation.
* Open any issue from the project;
* The field will disappear after loading the page.

h3. Actual Results

The fields will be hidden, even if they're set as context fields (which were not supposed to be hidden even if empty)
Attached, I've recorded a video for your better understanding.

h3. Expected Results

Users should be able to see the field even it is only set on the screen associated with the "View issue" operation.

h3. Workaround

Set the same screen on "View issue" and "Edit issue" operation *OR* all the fields in the screen associated with "View issue" should be in the "Edit issue" operation
fields.summary: When the field is set on "View issue" screen and not "Edit issue" the field disappears after loading the page (New issue view)

fields.description: This is the feature request (suggest in the [community post|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Markdown-for-info-panel-in-Jira-new-issue-view/qaq-p/1183207]) to add markdown support for info / warning / error ... panels.
fields.summary: Markdown support for panels

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding a web link on the ticket, the favicon truncates from the web link section. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Include a web link to the ticket from Jira
 # Compare the web link section from old and new issue view
# Old issue view shows the favicon as expected but the same favicon truncated from new issue view. 

h3. Expected Results
New issue view show the favicon as old issue view.\

h3. Actual Results

Favicon gets truncated from the new issue view. 

h3. *Note* 
The new issue view doesn't show the web link which is in the resolved state. 

h3. Workaround

View the web link from old issue view.
fields.summary: Favicons truncated from the web link in new issue view

fields.description:
When importing issues into a site using the JSON importer, big changes may break the database statistics leading to some temporary performance issues on JQL searches. This usually gets resolved when the weekly scheduled DB statistics update kicks in. 

Suggestion :
Allow the JSON importer to update the DB statistics after a huge import.
fields.summary: Allow the JSON importer to update the database statistics

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Deleting a project that contains issues that you've worked on will still appear on "Your Work" section. This will also happen for issues you no longer have access to (browse projects permission or issue security level).

!Screenshot 2020-04-02 at 4.21.32 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project and issues
 # Assigned the issues to yourself
 # Delete the project that contains the issue OR remove browse projects permission
 # Got to *Your work* and look for the issue

h3. Expected Results
The issue will no longer appear on the "Your work" section 

h3. Actual Results
The issue is still being displayed and clicking on the issue will display "We couldn't connect to that issue" or "You don't have access to this issue".

 !Screenshot 2020-04-02 at 4.28.04 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Deleted or restricted issues will still appear on "Your Work" section

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When typing the exact match of an existing label, if that label is a substring of other labels it will not always appear first.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a bunch of labels starting with "no" (e.g. "nothing", "nobody")
 # Create the exact label "no"
# Search for the exact label "no" on a new issue

h3. Expected Results
"no" will be the first result, meaning a user can add it by pressing Enter or Space.

h3. Actual Results
Other labels with "no" as a substring will be returned first.

h3. Workaround
Add a space after the label i.e. "no ". Then it will be offered to add as a new label. When added, the trailing whitespace will be stripped.
fields.summary: Label suggestions don't show an exact match first

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding another custom field with "Labels" type , the value list in the "new issue view" are the same as the system "Labels" field value.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new custom field with "Labels" custom field type with name "Client"
 # Add the field to the create and View/Edit screen
# Then, create a new issue and assure the new field and the system "Labels" field added with a different value. For example , set Client = ClientA and Labels = Makan 
# Now, create another issue without fill in any value for both field.
# Then, open the issue using new issue view and edit the field from there.

h3. Expected Results
Client field will have "ClientA" value and Labels field will have "Makan" value

h3. Actual Results
Both field only have "Makan" value :-

 !Screenshot 2020-04-01 at 8.07.06 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2020-04-01 at 8.07.14 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Edit the issue using old issue view.

 !Screenshot 2020-04-01 at 8.08.50 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: When adding another custom field with "Labels" type , the value list in the "new issue view" are the same with the system "Labels" field value

fields.description:
Currently, I got an e-mail notification about my activities in issues only when I create an issue. All other changes are not reported to my e-mail, only the changes made by others. I am missign information in my email about changes done by me..

It would be nic to have such choice in personal preferencies if persons is interrested to receive e-mail notfications about all changes or only by 2nd person made in issues.

 

Thanks.
fields.summary: Issue - email notifications also to person who made the change
Add aggregation methods to Collections

fields.description:
h3. {color:#505f79}👩🏻‍🔬 WORKING ON{color}

 
||Feature||Expected date||
|Column configuration, custom filters and more refinements|February 2022|
|Move to next/previous issue within the issue view|Q4 2021|

 
h3. {color:#00875a} 🎉 SHIPPED{color}

 
||#||Feature||Date shipped||
|10|Save custom search filters and share search criteria with other users|October 2021|
|9|Wider field support for more powerful searches       |August 2021|
|8|[New JQL Editor, multi-project search|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/Jira-Announcement-Unlock-the-power-of-search-with-the-new-JQL/ba-p/1750670]|July 2021|
|7|Issue import and bulk issue edit|May 2021|
|6|[Inline editing for status field, Issue operations in list view, performance improvements|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/Jira-Announcement-Update-issues-right-from-the-list-view-in-the/ba-p/1664269#U1672139]|April 2021|
|5|Status category filter and better handling of long lists of options in filters|March 2021|
|4|[List view and exports in issue navigator|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/Take-control-of-your-issues-with-list-view-and-exports/ba-p/1560473]|December 2020|
|3|New issue navigator in classic projects for Jira Software, JSM and JWM|August 2020|
|2|[Filter by issue type(epics, bugs, stories etc) in team-managed issue navigator|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Next-gen-articles/You-asked-for-it-we-delivered-issue-type-refinement-in-next-gen/ba-p/1401005]|May 2020|
|1|[New issue navigator in next-gen projects|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Next-gen-articles/Introducing-issue-navigator-in-next-gen-projects/ba-p/1339049]|April 2020|

 
----
h2. FAQ
h3. What are we doing?

After analysing your feedback, we've realised that there is a lot of confusion caused by multiple inconsistent issue search pages in Jira. We want to simplify search in Jira and make it faster and more scalable. In this journey we will be adding features to the new issue navigator and after it has all the functionality of advanced search, we will *replace advanced search with the new issue navigator*.

Here's what we are achieving with this change:
 * A consistently powerful issue search experience in Jira
 * Faster and more scalable search
 * Updated technology behind search, making it easier to add new features
 * Simple and modern UI 

h3. Why are we doing this?

We receive lots of great feedback from our customers on how we should improve issue search in Jira. One of the top items that caused confusion was the disparity in the user experience between advanced search and project "issues" tab. Moreover, our customers want the search to be more user friendly and powerful, we need to modernise the tech stack of search to make that happen. 
h3. What to expect next?

To keep you informed, we will use this issue to communicate the progress of our work. Please +*WATCH*+ this ticket to stay updated on the latest.
h3. How do I enable the issue navigator in my team-managed projects ?

You can enable issue navigator via the features page under team-managed project settings in Jira Cloud. After you have enabled the issue navigator, _Issues_ will appear in the sidebar on the left.
h3. What will happen to my marketplace apps ?

To ensure a smooth transition of marketplace apps, we ran a [testing program|https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/unifying-search-experience-in-jira-replacing-advanced-search/45000] to allow time for app developers to transition to the new issue navigator. 
h3. What about the issues that currently exist in Advanced search?

A lot of the issues with advanced search are getting fixed and you can try the fixed out today in the new issue navigator. An example is JRACLOUD-76031 Unify the scrollbar appearance on different platforms.  More documentation on the new issue navigator [here|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/enable-the-project-issue-navigator/].
fields.summary: Consolidated search for Jira Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Creating the most basic rule to remove issuelink with Automation rule runs successfully but doesn't remove the linked Issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a rule with Trigger e.g. Issue Created
 # Then create an action to delete issuelink

h3. Expected Results
Rule should run and delete the linked issue


h3. Actual Results
Rule runs successfully with message on the Audit log "No Action were performed"
 !Screenshot 2020-03-31 at 6.26.37 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Note
This doesn't work when issues are cloned from another issue. Via Issue creation it works. However the behaviour should be consistent as cloning is an actual issue creation.
 !Screenshot 2020-04-08 at 4.47.57 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Using Issue creation button rather than cloning
fields.summary: Delete Issuelink Automation rule doesn't work when Issues are cloned

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Custom fields of the type 'Domain of Reporter' are not showing in the new issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a custom field of type 'Domain of Reporter' to a request type.
 # Open a request with the above request type.

h3. Expected Results

The custom field should show in the context fields if not empty and as hidden if empty.
h3. Actual Results

The field is not showing.
h3. Workaround

There is no current workaround
fields.summary: Custom field of type Domain of Reporter not showing in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On the new Jira issue view, attachments cannot be embedded on public comments via  transition screens. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set a resolve transition screen
 # Configure the screen to allow attachments
 # Use the transition and try to embed an attachment to the customer response. 

h3. Expected Results

As with the old view, existing and new attachments can be embedded on the customer response using the attachment icon. 

 !Old view.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

In the new view, there is no way to embed attachments on the public comments via transition screens. The icon never appears even if there are existing attachments on the issue or new files are attached. 

 !new view.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Use the old issue view or manually embed the attachment using the [syntax|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=all]

 !attachment workaround.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Cannot embed attachments on customer response via transition

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
A custom field of the type 'Domain of Reporter' will return empty when the reporter is an Atlassian account that has their email address visibility set to 'Only you and admins' in their Profile and visibility preferences. This is the expected behavior due to privacy rules but it's not clear that this is the reason for the field being empty.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a custom field of type 'Domain of Reporter' to a request type.
 # Create a request with the above request type from an Atlassian account that has their email address visibility set to 'Only you and admins'.

 Note: Reproducing this behavior requires two Atlassian accounts as you're always able to see the email address of your own Atlassian account.

h3. Expected Results
The custom field should display a message saying the email is private as in the Customers menu.

h3. Actual Results
The field is empty.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Custom field of type Domain of Reporter returns empty

fields.description:
h3. Problem statement
At the moment filter subscriptions that are emailed show only the dates, not the exact time (hours and minutes), unlike the export tool.

h3. Suggestion
Add the possibility of choosing the date format (only dates or dates+time).
fields.summary: Customize date format for Filter subscriptions
Comment ADF conversion adds the wrong media ID in the ADF body causing images/attachments to not render in the new issue view

fields.description:
As of now, the [rich filter for Dashboard|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1214789/rich-filters-for-jira-dashboards?hosting=server&tab=overview] doesn't have a Cloud version yet and this could be a high demand feature for the Cloud user.

It would be beneficial if we can enhance the REST API for Jira Cloud so that we can implement something similar or the vendor can develop the wanted feature using the enhanced REST API.

h4. Current  Scenario
 It's not possible to roll out rich filter due to the limitation from REST API

h4. Vendor Feedback
"Unfortunately, it is true, there is no Rich Filters version available for Cloud. The problem is that the APIs available for the Cloud Jira instances are very limited and don't really allow us to do the types of operations required by the rich filters. We're constantly looking for solutions that would allow us to provide a Cloud version of the app but so far we haven't identified a clear technical path. Unfortunately, at least on the short/medium term there is no plan to provide a rich filter cloud version (only the Server and DC versions are available). If this changes in the future, we can certainly let you know."

h4. Suggestion
Improve REST API implementation.
fields.summary: Enhance REST API for Jira Cloud.

fields.description:
It would be nice if Automation for Jira could be able to access user property objects using Automation for Jira. Specifically towards this [endpoint|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-group-User-properties]

So any user property that is set, can be accessed with Automation for Jira to use in conjunction to features such as
* Send Twillio/SMS notification.
fields.summary: Ability to access Jira user property details with Automation for Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Updating a custom field with the name project throws a system error as it conflicts with the system field project
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field with the name *project* and configure it in any screen
 # While updating the value for the field, the user will encounter the below error initially after which the value will get updated:

 !image-2020-03-30-12-15-04-092.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The value should get updated without any error or not allow the user to create the field with the name *project*
h3. Actual Results
The user encounters the below error after which the value gets updated:
 !image-2020-03-30-12-15-04-092.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Modifying the name from project to Project also solves this.
fields.summary: Updating a custom field with name project throws an system error as it conflicts with the system field project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Epics have a value set in the *Epic Color* field when changing their colors in the backlog.

In the old view, you can edit the field directly, adding the correct value:
 !Screen Shot 2020-03-27 at 16.09.04.png|thumbnail! 

Currently, the new issue view does not displayed that field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create an Epic;
* Check in the new issue view.

h3. Expected Results

The Epic Color field will be displayed.

h3. Actual Results

The Epic Color field is not displayed in the new view.

h3. Workaround

Switch to the old view to see that field.
fields.summary: Epic Color not displayed in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The commit issue count is off in new JIRA issue view. Showing incorrect number of committed file changes. The same issue does not happen in old JIRA issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Do a smart commit that includes lots of file changes to a JIRA ticket.
 # Once that is done, check the development panel to see if the amount of file changes are shown correctly.

h3. Expected Results

The new JIRA issue view should show the exact file commit changes (16 file changes).

 !image-2020-03-27-23-10-45-064.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The development panel shows no file commit changes or the numbers are showing wrongly (5 instead of 16 file changes).

 !image-2020-03-27-23-20-04-706.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Revert back to old JIRA issue view by turning off Atlassian Labs at https://<domain_name>.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa
fields.summary: The commit file count in the development panel for new JIRA issue view is inaccurate

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the user tries creating a sub-task from a parent issue, the create screen is opened with the default issue type.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project with multiple sub-task types
 # Set a required field on Field Configuration
 # Open a parent issue and click on the button to create a subtask
 # Choose a sub-task type and hit enter
 # The screen to create the issue will be open and the type will be set to another issue type

 [^subtask.mp4] 

--- This issue is intermittent

h3. Expected Results
The selected type on parent issue will be the same on create screen

h3. Actual Results
The create screen displays a different issue type, not the one selected on the parent issue

h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Sub-task create screen displays incorrect issue type

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Issue search drop-down does not show the existing values for custom field type Label

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field using the label type and associate with a screen
 # Populate this field in some issues with labels
 # Try to search for this in Filters using the basic search
 # The existing labels are not shown in the search

This issue is observed if fields are only valid for a particular issue type context.

!Screen Shot 2020-03-26 at 12.30.32.png|width=586,height=185!
h3. Expected Results

The existing labels are shown in the search
h3. Actual Results

The existing labels are not shown in the search

h3. Workaround

* Switch to advanced JQL search and search for your field.
 !Screen Shot 2020-03-26 at 12.11.01.png|thumbnail! 

* Alternatively, turn off the new issue view and use the old view instead.
* Or, check the context set for this field. If the context is limited using the issue type, this field won't display all the options. We could remove this context and set it to Global (all issue type)
fields.summary: Issue search drop-down does not show the existing values for custom field

fields.description:
When all sub-tasks of a parent task are in "Done" status, "Update Parent Issue" pop-up should appear to ask user if they want to update the parent's task status to "Done" too, similar to how it appears in the board:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

This can appear when closing a sub-task in issue view.
fields.summary: "Update Parent Issue" pop-up in issue view when all sub-tasks are "Done"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you are a Jira administrator and your system or user's default language is set to French and you impersonate another user the pop-up dialogue that should provide a link to revert back to you main account when finished with the impersonation has the correct text but no clickable link.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Be a site-admin on Jira.
 # Set the default language of your system to French or set the language of a user account to French.
 # Impersonate the user with the French language setting.

h3. Expected Results
The pop-up dialogue should have a link that will revert you back to your default account and exit impersonation.
h3. Actual Results
The correct text appears but no clickable link.

h3. Workaround
Exit your browser or clear cache to revert back to your actual account.
fields.summary: User impersonation in french offers no link to go back to your original account

fields.description:
The error message is not consistent for the JQL key word 'was in' , when used with issuetype along with Id.
h4. How to replicate
 * Go the global issue navigation. Type *issuetype was in "BUG"*.
 * We get the error message -->_History searches do not support the 'issuetype' field._
 * Now search for *issuetype was in (10002)*. Here the id of the issuetype BUG is 10002.
 * We get the error message --> _Error occurred communicating with the server. Please reload the page and try again._

h4. Expected results.
 * Error message should be consistent when used with issuetype id.
fields.summary: Please make the error message consistent for the JQL keyword 'was in'.

fields.description:
Ability to disable the "Allow any accounts using these email domains to join your site..." checkbox.

Causing not allow users to access our instance
fields.summary: Ability to disable the "Allow any accounts using these email domains to join your site..." checkbox

fields.description: I want to control  W.I.P limit in the board, not just by column. Because it's the "right" in the Kanban method.
fields.summary: WIP limit in the board.

fields.description:
In Jira, there are a number of URLs that are always accessable anonymously, including, but not limited to:
/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa
/secure/Dashboard.jspa
/secure/ManageFilters.jspa
/issues

Although there are a number of feature requests to allow blocking access to these, I would like to propose a single solution to all of these. there is already a good solution that has been proven to work in Confluence cloud:

Anonymous Access global permissions.

In Confluence, there is an anonymous access global permission which must be enabled, or all pages to the instance will be blocked to unauthenticated users.
I would like to propose that this be an option made available for Jira as it will greatly add to the peace of mind of our customers knowing that they have a one-click solution to guarantee control over access to their instance.
fields.summary: Allow blocking of Anonymous access to pages in Jira cloud instance

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
There are times when you need to take your Jira Cloud data and put it into a Jira Server site. There are many reasons for this, such as auditing your data locally, testing out something, or a true Cloud to Server migration.   However with Jira Cloud having next-gen projects (and Server not having them), the process to create a backup intended for Jira Server is much more difficult to manage now for site-admins.  Now admins have to either convert all the next-gen projects into classic first, OR delete them before a backup can be made for Server.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be amazing if the server backup creation option could just create its backup file as if the next-gen projects had already been converted (don't actually convert them on the Cloud site, just in the backup file).  Since this backup is never intended to be used with another Jira Cloud site, the backup for server should just auto-convert them for you.


h3. Why this is important
It's difficult as a site-admin to know what data created by others in next-gen projects would still be needed after a migration.  This requires the site-admin to contact each project creator to see if that data is required.   Otherwise the admin has to make the gut wrenching decision to either delete or convert.  Both options are not ideal.


h3. Workaround 
Current workaround looks like this:
# create a _Cloud_ backup (not server backup)
# Create a temporary Cloud site
# Import that Jira Cloud Backup there (full restore)
# Convert or delete the next-gen projects in the temp site
# Then create a server backup
# Use that file to import to server
# destroy temp cloud site data
fields.summary: When creating a backup for Server (in Cloud), automatically convert next-gen projects into classic in the backup

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When editing the time tracking and adding the "Time spent" as zero, the error message "We could not save the changes Check your connection, then give it another try."

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add an issue to a classic project
# Click on *Time tracking* in the right side of the screen
# Set the value *0m* to the *Time spent* field and *5m* to the *Time remaining* field
# Click *Save*

h3. Expected Results

An error message saying *"Time Spent can not be zero."* is displayed

h3. Actual Results

The generic "We could not save the changes Check your connection, then give it another try." is displayed.

 !Screen Shot 2020-03-25 at 10.23.17 AM.png|thumbnail! 

Looking at the browser console logs, it's possible to see the following message:

{code}
{"errorMessages":["Worklog must not be null."],"errors":{"timeLogged":"Time Spent can not be zero."}}
{code}


h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When editing the time tracking and adding the "Time spent" as zero, a generic error is displayed

fields.description:
Currently there is no option to use add-on's or install the add-on's in Jira app for Mac. 
Jira app for Mac should support add-on's as supported in the Atlassian Cloud sites.
fields.summary: Jira App for Mac should support add-on's as supported in the Atlassian Cloud sites.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Issue disappears from Board when using 'Assigned to me' filter on Business Classic Project

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Business Classic Project
 # Create 2 or 3 issues and assign them to yourself
 # Select the *Assigned to me* filter
 # Select an issue created and once you close it the issue disappears from the Board

h3. Expected Results

Issues must continue showing on the Board

h3. Actual Results

The issue disappears from the Board and you need to refresh the Browser page to view them again

h3. Workaround

Refresh the web browser and the issues will reappear on the board again.
fields.summary: Issue disappears from Board when using 'Assigned to me' filter

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Browser's autocomplete overlaps project search in the drop-down and it is hard to pick the right project.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open any project in Jira
 # Try to switch to another project using drop-down on the left panel
 !image-2020-03-25-13-40-42-062.png|width=115,height=219!

h3. Expected Results

Browser autocomplete shouldn't be shown
h3. Actual Results

Browser's autocomplete field doesn't allow to properly pick a project
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Option to disable browser autocomplete when searching for a project

fields.description:
h3. *Problem*

When we go to Filters > Serch issues, we can add and remove columns when using the List view, but it doesn't apply to the Detail view.
h3. *Suggestion*

The Detail view shows the Issue Key, Issue type, and Summary (on "Issues" on Business and Software it also shows the assignee avatar) . It would be great if we could also select the fields as the List view.
fields.summary: Ability to add and remove fieds when using the "Detail view"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, all available manual trigger automation rules are displayed in the manual execution panel in the issue view.

h3. Suggested Solution
Filter the availability of rules for manual execution based on the "Condition" elements in the rule to determine if it passes them all.

h3. Workaround 
None at this time.
fields.summary: Filter Availability of Manual Rules Based on Existing Conditions

fields.description:
When working with swimlanes, the drop down menu shows: 

 

"Show below" option is on top.
"Show above" option is below that.

 

It would be much less confusing if they were ordered above/below rather than below/above.
fields.summary: 'Show below/above other swimlanes' are shown backwards in drop down menu

fields.description:
h3. *Problem*

With next-gen project, since it's independent of classic ones, we can create fields with the same name for each project. 

Also on Custom fields (System), it's possible to add the same name for fields with different types.

!Screen Shot 2020-03-24 at 10.01.44.png|width=154,height=305!
h3. *Suggestion*

Show the project key and the field type to better identify the fields, so we can select the correct field to show when adding it to a gadget in the dashboard, for example.
fields.summary: Show the project key and custom field type for the duplicated custom fields when adding fields to a gadget

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Ability to restrict trusted users from adding new users to the site.

h3. Suggested Solution
Currently, trusted users can invite new users to the site. Please restrict the functionality so that the trusted users will not be able to add new users to the site.

h3. Why this is important
Currently, the workaround we suggest the users, to change the role from Trusted to Basic but it will be really helpful for the users if possible to disable the trusted users from adding new users without changing the roles from Trusted to Basic.
fields.summary: Restricting the trusted users from adding new users to the site.

fields.description:
h3. *Problem*

Currently, there are few custom fields available for next-gen projects. 
 * [Available custom fields for next-gen projects|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/available-custom-fields-for-next-gen-projects/]

h3. *Suggestion*

Add Radio button custom field since it's a better option for JAWS and NVDA screen readers and it will benefit users who are blind or have low visibility.
fields.summary: Add Radio Button custom field to next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After the update on Chrome 80 about implementing the same-site cookies protection, the authentication outside the Jira page is not permitted. This is reported in this bug.
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-74055

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue Collector
 # Open the issue Collector and create the issue
 # The issue is created by the default reporter
 # *Optionally* enter the email field to make yourself as a reporter.

h3. Expected Results
The email might be mandatory and validated. 

h3. Actual Results
The email is optional 

h3. Workaround
Establish an invalid reporter in the issue Collector settings, this forces users to enter an email.
fields.summary: Validate Mandatory Reporter on Issue Collector

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using the Bulk Issues Import, it should explicitly display that there is a limit of 250 issues to be imported. Also, it should be able to stop the import while it is happening.
fields.summary: When using the Bulk Issues Import, the limit of 250 issues should be displayed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you create an issue and select the field for labels it will give you a suggestions list but when you are on the edit view and select the field for labels it will prompt a different suggestion list

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue and see the suggested list for that view
 # Once the issue is created go to the label field and see the dropdown and it will give you a different suggestion list.

h3. Expected Results

It should give you the same suggestions when searching for label´s on any issue view
h3. Actual Results

Displays different suggestions list depending on if you are on the create issue view or edit issue view

h3. Workaround

You need to use the old issue view to get the same suggestion list for labels
fields.summary: Label Suggestions should not change depending on the issue view you use

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When user is creating a rule that needs to select a status, there is no information if it is related to workflow or next-gen project.
This issue happens when the establish *multiple projects* in the rule details, all the status will be shown even if the project is not selected

 *Trigger:*
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

*Action:*
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create a rule;
 # select "issue transitioned" trigger;
 # choose a status (no identified)
 # select "transition issue" action;
 # choose a status (no identified).


h3. Expected Results

Users need to know if the status presented is from a next-gen project or workflow (classic). 
 For example:
 !Screen Shot 2020-03-23 at 11.43.25.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
There are some possible workarounds:
# Select all the status that are appearing;
# Check the id of the status and look for manually with APIs.
fields.summary: Multiple status when you create a rule

fields.description:
Next gen projects do no longer use 'Epic Link' custom fields. They've introduced a new mechanism for linking issues.

currently there is no API for the new mechanism we can use (and we'll have to add conditionals for Next gen projects to our edit issue action).
fields.summary: Setting epic link in next gen projects

fields.description:
Portfolio uses the concept of Parent Link and has a customfield.
We Should support this in Automation for Jira:

* Field value changed trigger

* Setting/editing on field actions

* Branch traversal

* smart-values
We are however searching for a method to (automatically) copy comments from high level issue types/Initiatives to 'lower' levels, or to set specific fields based on a issue transition on a higher level.
fields.summary: Support for JIRA Portfolio hierarchy and "Parent Link" fields

fields.description:
{panel}
h3. Summary

"Epic Link" clause validates the issue key provided, and fails the whole JQL query execution if provided issue key is invalid.  Apparently the validator is unnecessarily case sensitive, so when issue key is not provided in upper case, the query would fail with an error.
h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # *Search #1* (Epic link id in lower case won't return results): id=dev-3 OR "Epic Link"=dev-4
 !Screen Shot 2017-11-10 at 12.01.42 PM.png!
 # *Search #2* (Epic link id in upper case will return the expected result):
 !Screen Shot 2017-11-10 at 12.03.46 PM.png!
 # *Search #3* (searching by id only will return the expected result):
 !Screen Shot 2017-11-10 at 12.06.40 PM.png!
 # *Search #4* (searching by Epic Link only will return the expected result):
 !Screen Shot 2017-11-10 at 12.10.15 PM.png!

h3. Expected Results

The *search #1* should return the result, for the id value does match the issue's id.
h3. Actual Results

It won't return any results.
h3. Workaround

If you type the Epic Link value with upper case, it will return the expected results.
{panel}
{panel:title=Update 9 March 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3399ff|titleBGColor=#3399ff|bgColor=#e0e0e0}
This also applies if the Issue key value does not exist. You will received the following error:
{code:java}
No issues have a parent epic with key or name 'EPIC-50'
{code}
{panel}
fields.summary: "Epic Link" clause fails on issue key in lowercase notation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The *Label* field is not listing the created labels and when users search for an existing label, it always gives an option to create a new label field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Jira, add *Labels* field to the issue screen.
# Add a few test labels to the *Labels* field 
# Now add a custom label field to the issue screen and search for an existing label created. The same behavior is noticed even with system *Label* field.

h3. Expected Results
The users should be able to search for all the existing labels

h3. Actual Results
When users search for an existing label, users would get an option to create a new label for the existing label

Notes: The behavior is the same for classic and next-gen projects and this is also happening for custom fields with label type.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Created/existing labels are not showing up in the list of available labels, users would get an option to create a new label everytime searching for an existing label

fields.description:
Hi. Can we have dashboards on the mobile app version of Jira as well? We have several C-levels that are asking to see Project Dashboards on their mobile phones.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Dashboards on the mobile version

fields.description:
As a Software user, I'd like to be able to create new linked issues as it is possible for Business and Service Desk projects issues.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Currently, this feature is only available for Business and Service Desk projects and it would be awesome if we can create a new linked issue directly from the issue view.
fields.summary: As a Software user, I'd like to be able to create new linked issues as it is possible for Business and Service Desk projects issues

fields.description:
At this time REST API can't be restricted to a specific group of users and that is being tracked on [this|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-42122] suggestion. Due to that it would be nice to have some reports about REST API usage. 

This would grant us the ability to generate reports by user, most used endpoints among many other detailed levels of information about the calls being performed.
fields.summary: Provide a REST API usage report

fields.description:
h3. Description

At the moment next-gen is only for Jira Sotware and Jira Service Desk projects. It would be nice to have also next-gen business projects (Jira Core).
fields.summary: Next-gen also for Jira Core business projects

fields.description:
Currently, there is no functionality, to check the issues on a particular day with a particular status.

Example: Issues with status "Code Review" on Monday.

As a user, it will be great if the issues can be filtered out using JQL
fields.summary: As a user I want to see issues on a particular day using JQL

fields.description:
Currently it's hard to mention Jira users (like reporter, assignee) in Slack messages since Slack requires the slack user id.  

It should be possible to lookup a user's Slack ID on the fly:

https://api.slack.com/messaging/composing/formatting#mentioning-users

https://api.slack.com/methods/users.list

Requires some changes to our message editor though (ADF would help), so we can tell when a user is mentioned in a slack message, to look them up.

This also happen when you copy the comment body and send via external messages. If at mention users are on the comment body the accountId will show instead.
fields.summary: Better mentions in Slack messages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When description is defined for priorities/issue types and translated to English US as per the below screenshot, other users when having their default profile language set to English US, sees the same description Users when having their default profile language set to English UK, sees the description different.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Translated the priority descriptions to English US. When default language is in English US, works as expected. Changed default language to English UK  Priority description shows different comments.

h3. Expected Results
Priority/Issue type description should show as it is set in the description.

h3. Actual Results
Descriptions are not showing as how it is set.

h3. Workaround
Create new priorities and set the descriptions as this issue only persist with the default priorities.
This has been observed for Issue types as well.
fields.summary: Translations for priorities, statuses and Issue types are not working

fields.description:
Next-gen Project should have an option to restrict project access for single group.

Scenario: 
If I have to restrict a project for a single group, I have to make the next-gen project access to “*Private*“, and then add all other groups to that project which will be a tedious task. if I have more than 20 groups in my instance and adding all groups instead of removing just one group is a bit of manual and time consuming work. 
A simple option of blocking the project access by 'group/groups' can be very helpful.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict Next-gen project access to single group or groups.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44969].
  {panel}

h5. Problem definition
Currently JIRA projects can only have a single key associated to it. This is undesirable on certain circumstances.

h5. Suggestion
The idea is to provide aliases for project keys. For instance assume you have the process of having two distinct projects in JIRA for a single project "Foo". One for development and one after the project was released:

Project key: FOO (for released builds)
Project key: FOODEV (for development builds)

Before the project goes live, you only set-up the FOODEV project in JIRA.

It would be great if you could specify a project key alias to FOODEV called FOO which can then be used to look-up FOODEV issues as long as the alias is active.
At the point the project is released you can then remove the alias and add a FOO-project.

The net outcome is that all your employees will always work with the "FOO" project key and it will automatically use the FOODEV-project during the early development phase while later it will automatically use the FOO-project.

No more need to rectify the long project key names for administrators.
fields.summary: Provide project key aliasing

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

OK and Cancel buttons are covered from the drop-down Label list field

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to an issue
 # Select the Label field and once the drop-down list is displayed the buttons 'OK' and 'Cancel' are covered by this list of labels

h3. Expected Results

Select the labels that you need and click on OK or Cancel

h3. Actual Results

You need to tab to the button due to it is not reachable

h3. Workaround

Select the labels that are needed and click outside the field and list so it would keep the labels on the field
fields.summary: OK and Cancel buttons are covered from the drop-down Label list field

fields.description:
Ability to get Comment Box show all the header icons on the Transition screen

h3. Comment box from Transition issue

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Comment box from New Jira issue view

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to get Comment Box show all the header icons on Transition screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The user is performing CSV Imports in which the importer while trying to import attachments is throwing an exception, we tried to find more information on these exceptions but these don't seem to be logged in the "micros_jira_prod_us*" event type, thus we're not able to state what is going wrong with the procedure.

The example CSV has 2 attachments (both stored in the customer's Jira, but we tested and it should work).

* File that works (/) 
{code}2019-12-26 13:21;ahgoncalves;kisspng-quality-assurance-question-hindi-product-design-fa-qa-course-jakho-5b936ae87c17f8.1954476815363878165083.jpg;https://mpng.subpng.com/20180908/sxu/kisspng-quality-assurance-question-hindi-product-design-fa-qa-course-jakho-5b936ae87c17f8.1954476815363878165083.jpg
{code}

* File that errors (x)
{code}
2019-12-26 13:21;ahgoncalves;2019-12-26_0912.png;https://mbi-ar:WKzFp8cnd7@jira.critical.pt/secure/attachment/424608/2019-12-26_0912.png
{code}



h3. How to Replicate

 
h3. Instance Details

 
h3. Investigation Done
 
 
h3. Please Help With
fields.summary: CSV Importer shows exception while importing attachments.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using the "width" parameter in the attachment tag in the description field makes the field fail to load in the new issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue in a project
 # Switch to the old issue view and add an attachment to this issue
 # Edit the field "Description" and add the following tag {{\!Screen Shot 2020-03-19 at 2.55.48 PM.png|thumbnail,width=500%!}}
 # Switch to the new issue view

h3. Expected Results

The "Description" field shows the attachment
h3. Actual Results

The "Description" field is shown as empty

!Screen Recording 2020-03-19 at 03.14 PM.gif|width=858,height=497!

h3. Workaround

* Disable the new issue view. To do this, please follow the steps below:

# Click the user avatar on the bottom-left of the screen and click on *Settings*
# Under *Jira labs*, next to *New Jira issue view*, click the green button to disable the feature

This feature can only be disabled at the user level. Please ask all your users to follow the steps above

* Remove the description using the old issue view, switch to the new issue view and re-add the description using the new issue view.
fields.summary: Using the "width" parameter in the attachment tag in the description field makes the field fail to load in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Webhook does not trigger for 'convert to subtask' issue operation despite being configured to listen to issue update event.

*Note* : Conversion from subtask to task also does not trigger webhook.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new issue in a JIRA project.
# Create a new webhook that listens to issue update event.
 !image-2020-03-19-16-51-05-180.png|thumbnail! 
# Convert the newly created issue in step 1 to a subtask

h3. Expected Results
Webhook is triggered due to the an issue update event (changing of issue type).

h3. Actual Results
No webhook is triggered.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Webhook does not trigger for 'convert to subtask' issue operation

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The description field in the new JIRA issue field fails to load when there are too many URLs in it. The symptoms are very similar to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-8940 where the description shows in the old JIRA issue view but not in the new JIRA issue view. 

Old JIRA issue view

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

New JIRA issue view

 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

The only difference is that the description is not over 32k characters. This also happens to comments; not only the description field.

h3. Steps to Replicate

Copy paste the long text in the private comments to the description field. Make sure it is the new JIRA issue view description field.

h3. Expected Result

The text is succesfully added to the new JIRA issue view description field.

h3. Current Result

Error is returned.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Turn off Atlassian Labs from https://<domain-name>.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa . This workaround will NOT work with next-gen which is new JIRA issue view by default.
fields.summary: New JIRA issue view description and comment field fails to show when there are too many URLs in it

fields.description: Should be able to see a consolidated view of the multiple projects. This is important to setting up a few new projects and to leverage classic/Next Gen for the same.
fields.summary: Viewing multiple projects on a single Roadmap

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira error should be readable and understandable. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field Component. 
 # On the create transition, add a post function so that the value of field components will be cleared. 
On the next transition, add a validator so that the field Components should be modified during the transition. 
The component field should also be a mandatory field during the create screen. 

h3. Expected Results
During the seconds transition, the system should throw custom error since the component field should be modified and was cleared in the create transition. 

h3. Actual Results

Unreadable error message 

h3. Workaround

Deleting the post function “The value of field Components” under create transition resolves the issue.
fields.summary: Jira error should be readable and understandable.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

You cannot disable "Status Change" notifications in iOS Jira Application. 

For example you able to do it in Android application.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Go to IOS Jira application. Go To Push notification. There is no ability to disable "Status Change" notifications.
h3. Expected Results

Ability to turn off push notifications in "Status Change"
h3. Workaround

No Workaround
fields.summary: Add ability to disable status change notifications in iOS application

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to search for content in the search bar of the new navigation search, after seeing the results, with the dropdown results showing up, if the user resizes the browser, the results won't follow the same, meaning, that it won't be responsive as it should.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Search for some content on the search bar of the new navigation;
 # After the results appear, resize the window of your browser until it passes the beginning of the dropdown results;

Video:
* https://share.getcloudapp.com/xQugxw1z

h3. Expected Results
The dropdown results will resize accordingly to the browser window.

h3. Actual Results
The dropdown results don't resize.

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: New navigation's search bar and results don't resize accordingly to the browser window

fields.description: Show the date/timestamp of when a card is initially created.  Right now the only way to back into this is to view the Notifications log for the dashboard.
fields.summary: Trello- Card created timestamp
Option to select Date format for user creation date while taking export of user data from User Management

fields.description:
Currently with Automation for Jira we have a Field value change trigger that gets triggered when value of a field changes.

In this trigger is we put multiple fields, the trigger is successful when any of the field's value changes.

Suggestion is to have an AND function so that the trigger is successful only when value of all the fields in the trigger change and not just one field.
fields.summary: Ability to create a trigger if Two field value change simultaneosly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding attachments, if the attachment screen is open for more than 60 minutes, any new attachments won't be attached to the issue, even if no errors are displayed. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open the attachment screen;
# Wait for 61 minutes;
# Try to attach an issue.

h3. Expected Results

A message will be displayed informing that the attachment can no longer be added or the attachment will be added as expected.

h3. Actual Results

The attachment seems to be added, but when refreshing the issue, the file is not there.

h3. Workaround

Before attaching a file, close the attachment screen and reopen it.
fields.summary: When adding attachments, there is not indication that the it has a 60 minutes limit to conclude the operation

fields.description:
Using Automation for Jira, it'd be nice to be able to create a rule that sends an email when a sprint is created that contains all of the issues created in that sprint.

Only seeing the option to include issue-specific details using smart values: https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/smart-values-general/
fields.summary: Add ability to send email on sprint creation including sprint stories

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Due to a fix released to a bug ([Issue Collectors won't work for clients using Chrome 80 which enables new samesite cookie controls|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-73683]), the issue collector will only display the issue key if the project's access is set to *Public*.

Now, only the following pop-up will be displayed:
 !image.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion

Implement a feature that will make the issue collector display the issue key despite the project being public or not.

h3. Workarounds

Use [E-mail this issue|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.metainf.jira.plugin.emailissue/cloud/overview] to send a notification to users in the create issue transition of the workflow associated with the issue collector project. 

Use [Service Desk|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/service-desk] as it allows interaction between external users with more robust functionality.
fields.summary: Display issue key once the issue is created via Issue collector despite project's permissions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently in the New Jira issue view, the text fields have fewer color options available to users.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue using the New Jira issue view.

h3. Expected Results
There are at least the same amount of color options in text fields for users to choose from, as this screen shot taken from the old view:

 !Screen Shot 2020-03-16 at 10.17.51.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
There are fewer color options in the New Jira issue view:

 !Screen Shot 2020-03-16 at 10.18.41.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Users can disable the New Jira issue view for now. To achieve this:

# Click the profile icon, on the bottom of your left sidebar, then *Settings* under "JIRA";
# On the "Jira Labs" section, click to disable/enable the *New Jira issue view*.
fields.summary: The New View has fewer text color options than the old view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Atlassian has completely deprecated the use of usernames from its REST API. Whenever admins try to create or update an issue using username, the application will show a misleading message about the field being required, instead of informing the wrong format of the input.

This is misleading in environments where that field is not required, as omitting the information successfully creates or updates the relevant issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Post a request to rest/api/2/issue;
# use username on the reporter field, as example.

h3. Expected Results
The following message is shown: "Usernames has been completely deprecated from the REST API. Please leverage the Atlassian Account ID for the relevant user".

h3. Actual Results
The following message is shown: "Reporter is required".

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: rest/api/2/issue "reporter is required" message is misleading

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Sub-task type is not displayed fully.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create additional sub-tasks with long length:
* Jira settings > Sub-tasks > Add sub-task issue type > enter new sub-task with long length
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
sub-tasks text to present fully on the screen

h3. Actual Results
Text is not displayed fully
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Using the old view will present text fully:
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Sub task issue type cannot be completely shown

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When loading a filter with "&" character the URL breaks.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a dashboard;
 # Create a filter that contains & on its name (In the example it is called Story & Scrum);
 # Add the Filter Counts gadgets in the Dashboard and add a filter into it;
 # Select a field and edit it;
 # Add the JQL filter = <filter name>

Steps being reproduced here: [https://share.getcloudapp.com/ApurJdzZ]
h3. Expected Results

The filter will return the results as expected.
h3. Actual Results

The URL breaks and the filter does not load properly.
h3. Workaround

Always use the filter ID when working with a JQL.
fields.summary: When loading a filter with "&" character the URL breaks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On Business Projects, using the "Assigned to me" filter on the board, when you click on an issue in the board and then click out, the assignee will vanish on that ticket and the ticket will disappear of the filter.

If you refresh the page it will get back to normal.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Business Project;
 # Create an issue and assign it to you;
 # Select the "Assigned to me" filter;
 # Open the assigned issue;
 # Close the assigned issue.

Video: [https://share.getcloudapp.com/KouWA40w]

h3. Expected Results
The assignee doesn’t vanish.

h3. Actual Results
The assignee vanishes and the ticket disappear from the filter.

h3. Workaround
Create a Software Project and migrate your issues to this new project, or refresh the page as the issue state is (incorrectly) held in the frontend until reload.
fields.summary: Using the Assigned to me filter, assignee vanishes from the board when clicking out of an issue

fields.description: As a product manager using a Jira structure to groom a backlog and plan product increments, I want to be able to click an issue key to close the detail view, so that I can quickly open and close the issue detail view while browsing, without needing to move mouse to the far-side of the screen to close the detail view. This would be especially helpful when viewing a structure with multiple columns but when screen space is limited.
fields.summary: Click Issue Link in Structure to Close Issue Details

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When viewing an _*Unassigned*_ issue in the old issue view, the avatar image is broken. Even the _*Automatic*_ assignee avatar is impacted.

This bug also affects the Issue Navigator when clicking on the assignee drop down, the avatar for the 'Unassigned' user is also not loading

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Browse to an _unassigned_ issue within your site in the old issue view.

h3. Expected Results

The unassigned avatar should be correctly displayed.
h3. Actual Results

!Screenshot 2020-03-13 at 5.21.24 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 From the browser's _Inspect Element_ results, the image does not load since the image URL is *not resolvable*.
{noformat}
https://avatar-cdn.atlassian.com/default?size=16&s=16 returns ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

For avatars not loading in old Jira issue view:
As a workaround, please consider using the _*new issue view*_.

For avatars not loading in issue navigator:
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unassigned avatar is not loading in old issue view and issue navigator

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a filter result gadget is created, the gadget will be pinned on the dashboard and created with the default 'Filter Results:<filter-name>' name. When you renamed the filter name from the gadget, this name should copied the name to the new dashboard as well.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new dashboard with filter result gadget
# Rename the gadget to a new name  (For eg. New Filter)
# Copy the dashboard from step 1
# Noticed that the name of the gadget become "gadget name+fitter name"

h3. Actual Results

The name of the filter result become "gadget name+fitter name"

h3. Expected Results

The full name of the gadget should be copied to the new dashboard


h3. Workaround

Rename the gadget using the rename option
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Copied dashboard did not copy the name for the filter result gadget.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Whenever we use the handler *"Add a comment before a specified marker or separator in the email body"* on the email handler, the CC assignee property does not work.

If we create a new email handler with this handler, we don't have the option to edit the property, but the UI will show the property set to true.

If we edit an existing email handler with this handler, the *CC assignee* property is not customizable.

If we switch to the handler *"Add a comment before a specified marker or separator in the email body"*, we can configure the property, however, it won't work if we switch back to *"Add a comment before a specified marker or separator in the email body"*
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a new email handler with the handler "Add a comment before a specified marker or separator in the email body"
 # Create an issue
 # Comment on issue
 # Reply the comment via email and cc a user

h3. Expected Result

CCed user should be set as the issue's assignee
h3. Actual results

Nothing happens
h3. Workaround

currently none
fields.summary: Using Mail handler "Add a comment before a specified marker or separator in the email body" does not respect CC assignee

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 22 July 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

We have now resolved this bug by introducing the following logic. The _original time_ and _remaining time_ fields will remain in sync, if the original time is changed after it is first entered, the remaining time will also change. However, once time is logged or if the remaining time is manually updated, this sync will no longer occur i.e. the remaining time will no longer change when the original time is updated.

Thanks

Tha Atlassian Cloud team
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

The Remaining estimate is not updated when the Original estimate is filled on the issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable the new issue view on the Profile Settings
 # Add Time Tracking to the issue's edit screen
 # Create a new issue
 # Open the issue and enter a value on Time estimate

h3. Expected Results

Remaining estimate receives the same value as Time estimate
h3. Actual Results

Remaining estimate is not updated
h3. Workaround

This specifically happens on the new issue view only. You can either permanently disable the new issue view on your Personal Settings or temporarily with the See the old view button
fields.summary: Remaining estimate is not updated when original estimate is filled on the issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Since March 6th we're starting to receive multiple reports that issue collectors are not working properly. The match reporter function is not working even when the reporters are actual users with the right permissions they're not added as reporters of the ticket as it should work.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue using an issue collector
# Make sure that your user is logged into Jira and has the access to create tickets
# Check the issue.
 
h3. Expected Results
The issue to be created and the reporter match.

h3. Actual Results
Either it won't work (if the 'attempt to match reporter' setting is on and there is no default reporter set) or it will default to the default reporter.

h3. Workaround
At this moment, users need to input their email address tied to their Atlassian Account to be set as the reporter.
fields.summary: Issue Collectors are not matching the Reporter
